rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--TERM

classVariables.definition: The collected name for an event observation.
classVariables.label: Reported Term
classVariables.name: --TERM
classVariables.notes: The verbatim or prespecified name of the event.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--MODIFY

classVariables.definition: A value which represents an alteration to a collected value for coding.
classVariables.label: Modified Reported Term
classVariables.name: --MODIFY
classVariables.notes: If the value for --TERM is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--LLT

classVariables.definition: The lowest-level term assigned to the event from MedDRA.
classVariables.label: Lowest Level Term
classVariables.name: --LLT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--LLTCD

classVariables.definition: The lowest-level term code assigned to the event from MedDRA.
classVariables.label: Lowest Level Term Code
classVariables.name: --LLTCD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--DECOD

classVariables.definition: Standardized or dictionary-derived text for the description of an event or intervention.
classVariables.label: Dictionary-Derived Term
classVariables.name: --DECOD
classVariables.notes: Equivalent to the Preferred Term ("PT" in MedDRA).

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--EVDTYP

classVariables.label: Medical History Event Date Type
classVariables.name: --EVDTYP
classVariables.notes: Specifies the aspect of the medical condition or event by which MHSTDTC and/or the MHENDTC is defined.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--PTCD

classVariables.definition: The preferred term code assigned to the event from the MedDRA dictionary.
classVariables.label: Preferred Term Code
classVariables.name: --PTCD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--HLT

classVariables.definition: The high-level term from the primary hierarchy assigned to the event from MedDRA.
classVariables.label: High Level Term
classVariables.name: --HLT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--HLTCD

classVariables.definition: The high-level term code from the primary hierarchy assigned to the event from MedDRA.
classVariables.label: High Level Term Code
classVariables.name: --HLTCD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--HLGT

classVariables.definition: The high-level group term from the primary hierarchy assigned to the event from MedDRA.
classVariables.label: High Level Group Term
classVariables.name: --HLGT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--HLGTCD

classVariables.definition: The high-level group term code from the primary hierarchy assigned to the event from MedDRA.
classVariables.label: High Level Group Term Code
classVariables.name: --HLGTCD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--CAT

classVariables.definition: A grouping or classification of the topic of the finding, event, or intervention.
classVariables.label: Category
classVariables.name: --CAT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SCAT

classVariables.definition: A further grouping or classification of the category for the topic of the finding, event, or intervention.
classVariables.label: Subcategory
classVariables.name: --SCAT
classVariables.notes: The category is in --CAT.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--PRESP

classVariables.definition: An indication that the event or intervention was prospectively stated or detailed on the CRF.
classVariables.label: Pre-Specified
classVariables.name: --PRESP
classVariables.notes: Value is "Y" for prespecified events, null for spontaneously reported events.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--OCCUR

classVariables.definition: An indication as to whether a prespecified event or intervention has occurred.
classVariables.label: Occurrence Indicator
classVariables.name: --OCCUR

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--REASOC

classVariables.label: Reason for Occur Value
classVariables.name: --REASOC
classVariables.notes: --REASOC is the reason the event did or did not occur, according to the value in --OCCUR.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--STAT

classVariables.label: Completion Status
classVariables.name: --STAT
classVariables.notes: Used to indicate when a question about the occurrence of a prespecified event was not answered. Should be null or have a value of "NOT DONE".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--REASND

classVariables.definition: The explanation for why requested information was not available.
classVariables.label: Reason Not Done
classVariables.name: --REASND
classVariables.notes: Used in conjunction with --STAT when its value is "NOT DONE".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--BODSYS

classVariables.definition: A standardized or dictionary-derived name for the body system or organ class.
classVariables.label: Body System or Organ Class
classVariables.name: --BODSYS
classVariables.notes: Body system or system organ class assigned for analysis from a standard hierarchy (e.g., MedDRA) associated with an event.

priorVersion.title: Body System or Organ Class Code

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--BDSYCD

self.title: Body System or Organ Class Code

classVariables.definition: A standardized or dictionary-derived short sequence of characters used to represent the body system or organ class.
classVariables.label: Body System or Organ Class Code
classVariables.name: --BDSYCD
classVariables.notes: MedDRA System Organ Class code corresponding to --BODSYS assigned for analysis.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SOC

classVariables.definition: The system organ class from the primary hierarchy assigned in the MedDRA dictionary.
classVariables.label: Primary System Organ Class
classVariables.name: --SOC

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SOCCD

classVariables.definition: The system organ class code from the primary hierarchy assigned in the MedDRA dictionary.
classVariables.label: Primary System Organ Class Code
classVariables.name: --SOCCD

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--CNTMOD

classVariables.label: Contact Mode
classVariables.name: --CNTMOD
classVariables.notes: The way in which the event, visit, or contact was conducted.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--EPCHGI

classVariables.label: Epi/Pandemic Related Change Indicator
classVariables.name: --EPCHGI
classVariables.notes: Indicates whether the event was changed due to an epidemic or pandemic. Not the same as whether a medical condition was caused by an epidemic or pandemic.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--LOC

classVariables.label: Location of Event
classVariables.name: --LOC
classVariables.notes: Describes anatomical location relevant for the event.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--LAT

classVariables.label: Laterality
classVariables.name: --LAT
classVariables.notes: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing laterality.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--DIR

classVariables.label: Directionality
classVariables.name: --DIR
classVariables.notes: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing directionality.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--PORTOT

classVariables.label: Portion or Totality
classVariables.name: --PORTOT
classVariables.notes: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the distribution (i.e., arrangement of, apportioning of).

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--PARTY

classVariables.definition: The role of the individual or entity responsible for the receipt of the transferred object (e.g., device, specimen).
classVariables.label: Accountable Party
classVariables.name: --PARTY
classVariables.notes: The party could be an individual (e.g., subject), an organization (e.g., sponsor), or a location that is a proxy for an individual or organization (e.g., site). It is usually a somewhat general term that is further identified in the --PRTYID variable.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--PRTYID

classVariables.definition: A sequence of characters used to uniquely identify the individual or entity responsible for the receipt of the transferred object (e.g., device, specimen).
classVariables.label: Identification of Accountable Party
classVariables.name: --PRTYID
classVariables.notes: Used in conjunction with --PARTY.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SEV

classVariables.definition: The quality or degree of harm associated with a finding or event, as collected.
classVariables.label: Severity/Intensity
classVariables.name: --SEV

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SER

classVariables.definition: A collected indication as to whether an event meets regulatory criteria for seriousness.
classVariables.label: Serious Event
classVariables.name: --SER
classVariables.notes: Valid values are "Y" and "N".

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--ACN

classVariables.definition: An action taken with study treatment as the result of the event.
classVariables.label: Action Taken with Study Treatment
classVariables.name: --ACN

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--ACNOTH

classVariables.definition: An action taken unrelated to study treatment, as the result of the event.
classVariables.label: Other Action Taken
classVariables.name: --ACNOTH

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--ACNDEV

classVariables.definition: An action taken with a device as the result of the event.
classVariables.label: Action Taken with Device
classVariables.name: --ACNDEV
classVariables.notes: The device may or may not be the device under study.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--REL

classVariables.definition: The investigator's assessment of the likelihood that the study treatment was the cause of the event.
classVariables.label: Causality
classVariables.name: --REL

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--RLDEV

classVariables.definition: A judgement as to the likelihood that the device caused the event.
classVariables.label: Relationship of Event to Device
classVariables.name: --RLDEV
classVariables.notes: The device may or may not be the device under study. Controlled terminology from EC Directive MEDDEV 2.7/3 March 2015 is required in EU but not US.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--RELNST

classVariables.definition: The investigator's assessment of the causal relationship of the event to a non-study treatment.
classVariables.examples: MORE LIKELY RELATED TO ASPIRIN USE
classVariables.label: Relationship to Non-Study Treatment
classVariables.name: --RELNST

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--PATT

classVariables.definition: A characterization of the temporal pattern of occurrences of the event.
classVariables.label: Pattern of Event
classVariables.name: --PATT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--OUT

classVariables.definition: The status associated with the result or conclusion of the event.
classVariables.label: Outcome of Event
classVariables.name: --OUT

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SCAN

classVariables.definition: An indication as to whether the reason an event was serious was because the event was associated with cancer.
classVariables.label: Involves Cancer
classVariables.name: --SCAN
classVariables.notes: Valid values are "Y", "N", and null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SCONG

classVariables.definition: An indication as to whether the reason an event is serious is because the event is associated with congenital anomaly or birth defect in an offspring of the subject.
classVariables.label: Congenital Anomaly or Birth Defect
classVariables.name: --SCONG
classVariables.notes: Valid values are "Y", "N", and null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SDISAB

classVariables.definition: An indication as to whether the reason an event is serious is because the event resulted in a significant, persistent, or permanent change, impairment, damage, or disruption in the subject's body function/structure, physical activities, and/or quality of life.
classVariables.label: Persist or Signif Disability/Incapacity
classVariables.name: --SDISAB
classVariables.notes: Valid values are "Y", "N", and null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SDTH

classVariables.definition: An indication as to whether the reason an event is serious is because the event resulted in death.
classVariables.label: Results in Death
classVariables.name: --SDTH
classVariables.notes: Valid values are "Y", "N", and null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SHOSP

classVariables.definition: An indication as to whether the reason an event is serious is because the event resulted in or prolonged hospitalization.
classVariables.label: Requires or Prolongs Hospitalization
classVariables.name: --SHOSP
classVariables.notes: Valid values are "Y", "N", and null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SLIFE

classVariables.definition: An indication as to whether the reason an event is serious is because the event resulted in a substantial risk of dying.
classVariables.label: Is Life Threatening
classVariables.name: --SLIFE
classVariables.notes: Valid values are "Y", "N", and null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SOD

classVariables.definition: An indication as to whether the reason an event is serious is because the event is associated with overdose.
classVariables.label: Occurred with Overdose
classVariables.name: --SOD
classVariables.notes: Valid values are "Y", "N", and null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SMIE

classVariables.definition: An indication as to whether the reason an event is serious is because the event may jeopardize the subject and may require intervention to prevent one of the other outcomes associated with serious adverse events.
classVariables.label: Other Medically Important Serious Event
classVariables.name: --SMIE
classVariables.notes: Valid values are "Y", "N", and null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--SINTV

classVariables.label: Needs Intervention to Prevent Impairment
classVariables.name: --SINTV
classVariables.notes: Valid values are "Y", "N", and null. Expected use is in medical device-related trials. It is part of the definition of a serious AE as represented in 21 CFR Part 803.3(w)(3). \n Records whether medical or surgical intervention was necessary to preclude permanent impairment of a body function, or prevent permanent damage to a body structure, with either situation suspected to be due to the use of a medical product.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--UNANT

classVariables.label: Unanticipated Adverse Device Effect
classVariables.name: --UNANT
classVariables.notes: The assessment is about a device identified in the data (i.e., which has an SPDEVID). The device may be ancillary or under study. \n Any serious adverse effect on health or safety or any life-threatening problem or death caused by or associated with a device, if that effect, problem, or death was not previously identified in nature, severity, or degree of incidence in the investigational plan or application (including a supplementary plan or application), or any other unanticipated serious problem associated with a device that relates to the rights, safety, or welfare of subjects. (21 CFR 812.3(s)).

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--RLPRT

self.title: Rel of AE to Device-Related Procedure

classVariables.label: Rel of AE to Device-Related Procedure
classVariables.name: --RLPRT
classVariables.notes: The investigator's opinion as to the likelihood that the device-related study procedure caused the AE (e.g., implant/insertion, revision/adjustment, explant/removal) \n The relationship is to a device-related procedure where the device is identified in the data (i.e., which has an SPDEVID). The device may be ancillary or under study.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--RLPRC

self.title: Rel of AE to Non-Dev-Rel Study Activity

classVariables.label: Rel of AE to Non-Dev-Rel Study Activity
classVariables.name: --RLPRC
classVariables.notes: The investigator's opinion as to the causality of the event as related to other protocol-required activities, actions or assessments (e.g., medication changes, tests/assessments, other procedures). \n The relationship is to a protocol-specified non-device-related activity where the device is identified in the data (i.e., which has an SPDEVID). The device may be ancillary or under study.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--CONTRT

classVariables.definition: An indication as to whether a non-study treatment was given because of the occurrence of the event.
classVariables.label: Concomitant or Additional Trtmnt Given
classVariables.name: --CONTRT
classVariables.notes: Valid values are "Y", "N", and null.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--TOX

classVariables.definition: The standardized or dictionary-derived name for an untoward event or finding.
classVariables.label: Toxicity
classVariables.name: --TOX
classVariables.notes: Sponsor should specify which scale and version is used in the Sponsor Comments column of the Define-XML document.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--TOXGR

classVariables.definition: A categorical classification of the severity of an event or finding, based on a standard scale, used in study data tabulation.
classVariables.examples: A toxicity grade from the NCI CTCAE.
classVariables.label: Toxicity Grade
classVariables.name: --TOXGR
classVariables.notes: Sponsor should specify which scale and version is used in the Sponsor Comments column of the Define-XML document.

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SDTM variable Events.--USCHFL

classVariables.definition: An indication that the performed test or observation was done at a time that was not planned.
classVariables.label: Unscheduled Flag
classVariables.name: --USCHFL
classVariables.notes: If a test or observation was performed based upon a schedule defined in the protocol, this flag should be null. Expected values are "Y" or null. This variable would not be needed when information on planned assessments is provided, such as when the Trial Visits (TV) and Subject Visits (SV) domains are used.

description: This SDTM class captures planned protocol milestones such as randomization and study completion, and occurrences, conditions, or incidents independent of planned study evaluations occurring during the trial (e.g., adverse events) or prior to the trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, GNRLOBSC, EVENTS, 2021-09-24)
label: Events
name: Events
